name: Melanoma Hypopharynx T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include a Tis category for melanomas of the upper aerodigestive sites (head and neck sites). Tis is mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore, T1 and T2 are omitted as are Stages I and II. 

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes:
\*TX is not defined in AJCC 7th edition
\**T0 is not defined in AJCC 7th edition
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated
Not documented in patient record
Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of one of the following subsites:
   Laryngopharynx
   Postcricoid area
   Posterior pharyngeal wall
   Pyriform sinus

Tumor involves mucosa of more than one subsite of hypopharynx WITHOUT fixation

Involvement of mucosa only:
    Larynx
    Nasopharynx
    Oropharynx

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as T4 [NOS]
Tumor invades deep soft tissue, cartilage, bone or overlying skin

Involvement of deep soft tissue or musculature of any structure in T3
Soft tissue, NOS

Any structure in T3 WITH tumor fixation

Fixation of hemilarynx or larynx

Central compartment soft tissues of neck including:
    Prelaryngeal strap muscles
    Subcutaneous fat

Bone excluding base of skull
Bone, NOS 
Cartilage, NOS
Cricoid cartilage
Esophagus
Hyoid bone
Overlying skin
Thyroid cartilage
Thyroid gland

Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Brain
Dura
Skull base
Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
Masticator space
Carotid artery
Prevertebral space
Mediastinal structures

Carotid artery (encased)
Prevertebral fascia/muscle(s)

Stated as T4b
